trans-unit.source: Deploy and manage Apache Storm topologies on HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Deploy and manage Apache Storm topologies on HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to deploy, monitor and manage Apache Storm topologies using the Storm Dashboard on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to deploy, monitor and manage Apache Storm topologies using the Storm Dashboard on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Use Hadoop tools for Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Use Hadoop tools for Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Deploy and manage Apache Storm topologies on HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Deploy and manage Apache Storm topologies on HDInsight

trans-unit.source: The Storm Dashboard allows you to easily deploy and run Apache Storm topologies to your HDInsight cluster by using your web browser.
trans-unit.target: The Storm Dashboard allows you to easily deploy and run Apache Storm topologies to your HDInsight cluster by using your web browser.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the dashboard to monitor and manage running topologies.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the dashboard to monitor and manage running topologies.

trans-unit.source: If you use Visual Studio, the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio provide similar features in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: If you use Visual Studio, the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio provide similar features in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: The Storm Dashboard and the Storm features in the HDInsight Tools rely on the Storm REST API, which can be used to create your own monitoring and management solutions.
trans-unit.target: The Storm Dashboard and the Storm features in the HDInsight Tools rely on the Storm REST API, which can be used to create your own monitoring and management solutions.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: **Apache Storm on HDInsight** - see Get started with Apache Storm on HDInsight for steps on creating a cluster
trans-unit.target: **Apache Storm on HDInsight** - see Get started with Apache Storm on HDInsight for steps on creating a cluster

trans-unit.source: For the **Storm Dashboard**: A modern web browser that supports HTML5
trans-unit.target: For the **Storm Dashboard**: A modern web browser that supports HTML5

trans-unit.source: For **Visual Studio** - Azure SDK 2.5.1 or newer and the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: For **Visual Studio** - Azure SDK 2.5.1 or newer and the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: See Get started using HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio to install and configure the HDInsight tools for Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: See Get started using HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio to install and configure the HDInsight tools for Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: One of the following versions of Visual Studio:
trans-unit.target: One of the following versions of Visual Studio:

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2012 with Update 4
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2012 with Update 4

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2013 with Update 4 or Visual Studio 2013 Community
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013 with Update 4 or Visual Studio 2013 Community

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2015 CTP6
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2015 CTP6

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Currently the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio only support Storm on HDInsight cluster version 3.2.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Currently the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio only support Storm on HDInsight cluster version 3.2.

trans-unit.source: Storm Dashboard
trans-unit.target: Storm Dashboard

trans-unit.source: The Storm Dashboard is a web page available on your Storm cluster.
trans-unit.target: The Storm Dashboard is a web page available on your Storm cluster.

trans-unit.source: The URL is **https://<clustername>.azurehdinsight.net/**, where **clustername** is the name of your Storm on HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The URL is **https://<clustername>.azurehdinsight.net/**, where **clustername** is the name of your Storm on HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: From the top of the Storm Dashboard, select **Submit Topology**.
trans-unit.target: From the top of the Storm Dashboard, select **Submit Topology**.

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions on the page to run a sample topology or to upload and run a topology that you created.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions on the page to run a sample topology or to upload and run a topology that you created.

trans-unit.source: the submit topology page
trans-unit.target: the submit topology page

trans-unit.source: Storm UI
trans-unit.target: Storm UI

trans-unit.source: From the Storm Dashboard, select the **Storm UI** link.
trans-unit.target: From the Storm Dashboard, select the **Storm UI** link.

trans-unit.source: This will display information about the cluster, in addition to any running topologies.
trans-unit.target: This will display information about the cluster, in addition to any running topologies.

trans-unit.source: the storm ui
trans-unit.target: the storm ui

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] With some versions of Internet Explorer, you may discover that the Storm UI does not refresh after you have first visited it.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] With some versions of Internet Explorer, you may discover that the Storm UI does not refresh after you have first visited it.

trans-unit.source: For example, it may not show the new topologies you submitted, or it may show a topology as active when you previously deactivated it.
trans-unit.target: For example, it may not show the new topologies you submitted, or it may show a topology as active when you previously deactivated it.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft is aware of this issue and is working on a solution.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft is aware of this issue and is working on a solution.

trans-unit.source: Main page
trans-unit.target: Main page

trans-unit.source: The main page of the Storm UI provides the following information:
trans-unit.target: The main page of the Storm UI provides the following information:

trans-unit.source: **Cluster summary**: Basic information about the Storm cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Cluster summary**: Basic information about the Storm cluster.

trans-unit.source: **Topology summary**: A list of running topologies.
trans-unit.target: **Topology summary**: A list of running topologies.

trans-unit.source: Use the links in this section to view more information about specific topologies.
trans-unit.target: Use the links in this section to view more information about specific topologies.

trans-unit.source: **Supervisor summary**: Information about the Storm supervisor.
trans-unit.target: **Supervisor summary**: Information about the Storm supervisor.

trans-unit.source: **Nimbus configuration**: Nimbus configuration for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Nimbus configuration**: Nimbus configuration for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Topology summary
trans-unit.target: Topology summary

trans-unit.source: Selecting a link from the **Topology summary** section displays the following information about the topology:
trans-unit.target: Selecting a link from the **Topology summary** section displays the following information about the topology:

trans-unit.source: **Topology summary**: Basic information about the topology.
trans-unit.target: **Topology summary**: Basic information about the topology.

trans-unit.source: **Topology actions**: Management actions that you can perform for the topology.
trans-unit.target: **Topology actions**: Management actions that you can perform for the topology.

trans-unit.source: **Activate**: Resumes processing of a deactivated topology.
trans-unit.target: **Activate**: Resumes processing of a deactivated topology.

trans-unit.source: **Deactivate**: Pauses a running topology.
trans-unit.target: **Deactivate**: Pauses a running topology.

trans-unit.source: **Rebalance**: Adjusts the parallelism of the topology.
trans-unit.target: **Rebalance**: Adjusts the parallelism of the topology.

trans-unit.source: You should rebalance running topologies after you have changed the number of nodes in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: You should rebalance running topologies after you have changed the number of nodes in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: This allows the topology to adjust parallelism to compensate for the increased or decreased number of nodes in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: This allows the topology to adjust parallelism to compensate for the increased or decreased number of nodes in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Understanding the parallelism of a Storm topology.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Understanding the parallelism of a Storm topology.

trans-unit.source: **Kill**: Terminates a Storm topology after the specified timeout.
trans-unit.target: **Kill**: Terminates a Storm topology after the specified timeout.

trans-unit.source: **Topology stats**: Statistics about the topology.
trans-unit.target: **Topology stats**: Statistics about the topology.

trans-unit.source: Use the links in the **Window** column to set the timeframe for the remaining entries on the page.
trans-unit.target: Use the links in the **Window** column to set the timeframe for the remaining entries on the page.

trans-unit.source: **Spouts**: The spouts used by the topology.
trans-unit.target: **Spouts**: The spouts used by the topology.

trans-unit.source: Use the links in this section to view more information about specific spouts.
trans-unit.target: Use the links in this section to view more information about specific spouts.

trans-unit.source: **Bolts**: The bolts used by the topology.
trans-unit.target: **Bolts**: The bolts used by the topology.

trans-unit.source: Use the links in this section to view more information about specific bolts.
trans-unit.target: Use the links in this section to view more information about specific bolts.

trans-unit.source: **Topology configuration**: The configuration of the selected topology.
trans-unit.target: **Topology configuration**: The configuration of the selected topology.

trans-unit.source: Spout and Bolt summary
trans-unit.target: Spout and Bolt summary

trans-unit.source: Selecting a spout from the **Spouts** or **Bolts** sections displays the following information about the selected item:
trans-unit.target: Selecting a spout from the **Spouts** or **Bolts** sections displays the following information about the selected item:

trans-unit.source: **Component summary**: Basic information about the spout or bolt.
trans-unit.target: **Component summary**: Basic information about the spout or bolt.

trans-unit.source: **Spout/Bolt stats**: Statistics about the spout or bolt.
trans-unit.target: **Spout/Bolt stats**: Statistics about the spout or bolt.

trans-unit.source: Use the links in the **Window** column to set the timeframe for the remaining entries on the page.
trans-unit.target: Use the links in the **Window** column to set the timeframe for the remaining entries on the page.

trans-unit.source: **Input stats** (bolt only): Information about the input streams consumed by the bolt.
trans-unit.target: **Input stats** (bolt only): Information about the input streams consumed by the bolt.

trans-unit.source: **Output stats**: Information about the streams emitted by this spout or bolt.
trans-unit.target: **Output stats**: Information about the streams emitted by this spout or bolt.

trans-unit.source: **Executors**: Information about the instances of the spout or bolt.
trans-unit.target: **Executors**: Information about the instances of the spout or bolt.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Port** entry for a specific executor to view a log of diagnostic information produced for this instance.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Port** entry for a specific executor to view a log of diagnostic information produced for this instance.

trans-unit.source: **Errors**: Any error information for this spout or bolt.
trans-unit.target: **Errors**: Any error information for this spout or bolt.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight Tools can be used to submit C# or hybrid topologies to your Storm cluster.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight Tools can be used to submit C# or hybrid topologies to your Storm cluster.

trans-unit.source: The following steps use a sample application.
trans-unit.target: The following steps use a sample application.

trans-unit.source: For information about creating your own topologies by using the HDInsight Tools, see [Develop C# topologies using the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio](hdinsight-storm-develop-csharp-visual-studio-topology.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about creating your own topologies by using the HDInsight Tools, see [Develop C# topologies using the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio](hdinsight-storm-develop-csharp-visual-studio-topology.md).

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to deploy a sample to your Storm on HDInsight cluster, then view and manage the topology.
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to deploy a sample to your Storm on HDInsight cluster, then view and manage the topology.

trans-unit.source: If you have not already installed the latest version of the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio, see Get started using HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already installed the latest version of the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio, see Get started using HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio, select **File** > **New** > **Project**.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio, select **File** > **New** > **Project**.

trans-unit.source: In the **New Project** dialog box, expand **Installed** > **Templates**, and then select **HDInsight**.
trans-unit.target: In the **New Project** dialog box, expand **Installed** > **Templates**, and then select **HDInsight**.

trans-unit.source: From the list of templates, select **Storm Sample**.
trans-unit.target: From the list of templates, select **Storm Sample**.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the dialog box, type a name for the application.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the dialog box, type a name for the application.

trans-unit.source: image
trans-unit.target: image

trans-unit.source: In **Solution Explorer**, right-click the project, and select **Submit to Storm on HDInsight**.
trans-unit.target: In **Solution Explorer**, right-click the project, and select **Submit to Storm on HDInsight**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If prompted, enter the login credentials for your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If prompted, enter the login credentials for your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: If you have more than one subscription, log in to the one that contains your Storm on HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: If you have more than one subscription, log in to the one that contains your Storm on HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Select your Storm on HDInsight cluster from the **Storm Cluster** drop-down list, and then select **Submit**.
trans-unit.target: Select your Storm on HDInsight cluster from the **Storm Cluster** drop-down list, and then select **Submit**.

trans-unit.source: You can monitor whether the submission is successful by using the **Output** window.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor whether the submission is successful by using the **Output** window.

trans-unit.source: When the topology has been successfully submitted, the **Storm Topologies** for the cluster should appear.
trans-unit.target: When the topology has been successfully submitted, the **Storm Topologies** for the cluster should appear.

trans-unit.source: Select the topology from the list to view information about the running topology.
trans-unit.target: Select the topology from the list to view information about the running topology.

trans-unit.source: visual studio monitor
trans-unit.target: visual studio monitor

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You can also view **Storm Topologies** from **Server Explorer** by expanding **Azure** > **HDInsight**, and then right-clicking a Storm on HDInsight cluster, and selecting **View Storm Topologies**.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You can also view **Storm Topologies** from **Server Explorer** by expanding **Azure** > **HDInsight**, and then right-clicking a Storm on HDInsight cluster, and selecting **View Storm Topologies**.

trans-unit.source: Use the links for the spouts or bolts to view information about these components.
trans-unit.target: Use the links for the spouts or bolts to view information about these components.

trans-unit.source: A new window will open for each item selected.
trans-unit.target: A new window will open for each item selected.

trans-unit.source: From the **Topology Summary** view, select **Kill** to stop the topology.
trans-unit.target: From the **Topology Summary** view, select **Kill** to stop the topology.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Storm topologies continue running until they are stopped or the cluster is deleted.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Storm topologies continue running until they are stopped or the cluster is deleted.

trans-unit.source: REST API
trans-unit.target: REST API

trans-unit.source: The Storm UI is built on top of the REST API, so you can perform similar management and monitoring functionality by using the REST API.
trans-unit.target: The Storm UI is built on top of the REST API, so you can perform similar management and monitoring functionality by using the REST API.

trans-unit.source: You can use the REST API to create custom tools for managing and monitoring Storm topologies.
trans-unit.target: You can use the REST API to create custom tools for managing and monitoring Storm topologies.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Storm UI REST API.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Storm UI REST API.

trans-unit.source: The following information is specific to using the REST API with Apache Storm on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: The following information is specific to using the REST API with Apache Storm on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Base URI
trans-unit.target: Base URI

trans-unit.source: The base URI for the REST API on HDInsight clusters is **https://<clustername>.azurehdinsight.net/stormui/api/v1/**, where **clustername** is the name of your Storm on HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The base URI for the REST API on HDInsight clusters is **https://<clustername>.azurehdinsight.net/stormui/api/v1/**, where **clustername** is the name of your Storm on HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Authentication
trans-unit.target: Authentication

trans-unit.source: Requests to the REST API must use **basic authentication**, so you use the HDInsight cluster administrator name and password.
trans-unit.target: Requests to the REST API must use **basic authentication**, so you use the HDInsight cluster administrator name and password.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Because basic authentication is sent by using clear text, you should **always** use HTTPS to secure communications with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Because basic authentication is sent by using clear text, you should **always** use HTTPS to secure communications with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Return values
trans-unit.target: Return values

trans-unit.source: Information that is returned from the REST API may only be usable from within the cluster or virtual machines on the same Azure Virtual Network as the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Information that is returned from the REST API may only be usable from within the cluster or virtual machines on the same Azure Virtual Network as the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For example, the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) returned for Zookeeper servers will not be accessible from the Internet.
trans-unit.target: For example, the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) returned for Zookeeper servers will not be accessible from the Internet.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: Now that you've learned how to deploy and monitor topologies by using the Storm Dashboard, learn how to:
trans-unit.target: Now that you've learned how to deploy and monitor topologies by using the Storm Dashboard, learn how to:

trans-unit.source: Develop C# topologies using the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Develop C# topologies using the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Develop Java-based topologies using Maven
trans-unit.target: Develop Java-based topologies using Maven

trans-unit.source: For a list of more example topologies, see [Example topologies for Storm on HDInsight](hdinsight-storm-example-topology.md).
trans-unit.target: For a list of more example topologies, see [Example topologies for Storm on HDInsight](hdinsight-storm-example-topology.md).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
